title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Glow-in-the-dark particles let succulents shine in the dark
items.description: New technique lets popular houseplants glow for a little while—without genetic engineering

items.title: Study shows how the human pelvis was reshaped for upright walking
items.description: Comparisons of pelvic development in human and primate embryos reveals key steps in human evolution

items.title: Here’s how the first proteins might have assembled, sparking life
items.description: RNA could have helped amino acids join up without preexisting protein machinery, lab study suggests

items.title: New look at 1755 quake, Europe’s largest ever, may foretell Atlantic ‘ring of fire’
items.description: Analysis suggests Earth’s mantle is peeling from the crust in the eastern Atlantic, a possible sign of the ocean’s eventual closure

items.title: Deep-sea worms fight poison with poison to survive in hydrothermal vents
items.description: Combining arsenic and sulfide in skin cells forms a less toxic mineral—and turns the animals bright yellow

items.title: Bats may mistake wind turbines for open sky, causing deadly collisions
items.description: Study may help explain why giant blades kill millions of the animals every year

items.title: Pushed out by Trump, New Jersey ecologist launches bid for Congress
items.description: Megan O’Rourke hopes to be a voice for science, also touts her blue-collar roots

items.title: Trump administration pushes ahead with NOAA climate and weather cuts
items.description: Despite congressional resistance, agency aims to cut research spending now

items.title: AI-generated scientific hypotheses lag human ones when put to the test
items.description: Machines still face hurdles in identifying fresh research paths, study suggests

items.title: In a first, pig lung survives and functions—briefly—in a person
items.description: Organ transplanted to brain-dead man lasts for more than a week before succumbing to an immune assault
